td.content: s:pt presents with mild sob of 2 weeks duration together with mild cough. pt is a male aged 39 yrs. o:Height 74 in, Weight 158 lbs, Temperature 98.6 F, Pulse 87, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 16, nose = no nasal congestion, NAD, normocephalic/atraumatic (nc/at), Pulm: mild LLL wheeze o/w cta-b, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, HEENT: WNL, CTA-LL, wheeze-LU, PERRL, A&O x 3, wheeze-BIL, Chest: RRR, No M/G/R a:Asthma p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed Albuterol ("rescue inhaler") - 2.5 mg as needed for SOB, and ordered FEV1, FEV1/VFC, PEF, Pulse Oximetry.

td.content: s:patient presents with severe sob for 8 days. patient also reports moderate fever, moderate wheezing. he is a 41 yr old white m. o:Height 74 in, Weight 158 lbs, Temperature 99.1 F, Pulse 74, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 17, O2 Sat: 90%, HEENT: WNL, Skin: mild perioral cyanosis, Pulm: mod bil wheezing with rales on LLL, wheeze-BIL, Mild distress in ""must sit up to breathe"", A&O x 3, Ext. No clubbing, cyanosis, edema, rales-LR, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest: RRR, audible wheezes w/o stethoscope a:Asthma p:performed E/M Level 2 (established patient) - Completed, and referred patient to pulmonary disease.
